data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Astroturf. Following the Mind Fuzz suite Amby quoted “Runnin’ With the Devil” (Van Halen). Magenta Mountain had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu, his eyes deceive you.” Magenta Mountain contained a tease of The Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress. Shanghai was on the printed setlist following The Grim Reaper and was attempted but not played due to technical difficulties. Ice V contained a Blindness (The Fall) jam. Poster By Jason Galea 215 Standard / 80 Foil Print

This show featured the debuts of Motor Spirit and Hate Dancin’. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Motor Spirit was incomplete. Sense contained Am I In Heaven? teases, Iron Lung quotes, Head On/Pill teases, and a Straws in the Wind vocal jam with “no sense at all” vocals. The Grim Reaper featured “I’m the Shrimp Reaper” vocals and contained Torture Chamber quotes. Following Astroturf, Cavs’ parents briefly appeared on stage. Down the Sink was played for the first time since May 24, 2022 (70 show gap) and had lyrics changed to “the street is where people jam.” Robot Stop contained Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases and quotes, an Extinction quote, and a proto-Grow Wings and Fly jam. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases. Iron Lung contained Sense teases. Poster By Jason Galea 1200 Standard / 300 Foil Prints

Rattlesnake contained Honey teases and Sleep Drifter teases/quotes. Honey contained Rattlesnake teases and Sleep Drifter teases. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Stu teased “Voodoo Child (Slight Return)” (Jimi Hendrix) during the leadup to Invisible Face. Invisible Face was played for the first time since June 6, 2017 (313 show gap) and was performed in full for the first time. Wah Wah contained The River teases. Ice V contained "Ain’t It Funky Now" (James Brown) teases. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs, during which Amby burned his copy of the setlist. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Chicago '23. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Invisible Face appears in setlists 40 times prior to this show. Of these, 29 have no recording available and one recording cuts off before the end of the song. The remaining 10 are all complete recordings of unfinished versions in which only the first two verses are performed. Based on these facts and the comments made by the band at this show, KGLW.net staff believe that the unavailable versions were also unfinished and that this is the first complete performance of Invisible Face. If anyone has conclusive evidence to the contrary, please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea 460 Standard / 130 Foil

Band sound tech Gaspard De Meulemeester was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion, which he did in French.  Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Crumbling Castle teases and quotes, Cellophane teases and quotes, Sea of Trees teases and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster By Jason Galea
420 Standard / 120 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.

Head On/Pill contained Witchcraft teases, Ice V teases and a Motor Spirit jam. Ice V contained Witchcraft teases. Hypertension contained teases of The Dripping Tap, Am I In Heaven? and People-Vultures. The Grim Reaper contained quotes of Torture Chamber, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “Sabotage” (Beastie Boys). Poster by Bassant Ahmed

Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.  Hypertension contained Evil Death Roll teases.  Ice V contained Presumptuous and Her and I teases.  Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap quotes and teases.  This Thing contained Hot Water quotes.

Poster By Max Löffler
data.venuename: Plaza Mayor de El Poble Espanyol

data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Hot Water, The River, Astroturf, Minimum Brain Size and Dragon have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster by Arno Kiss

Venusian 1 was last played 2023-03-11 (87 show gap). Witchcraft was swapped for Flamethrower because Stu had forgotten they played it the night before. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E., Automation, Minimum Brain Size, Sleep Drifter, Oddlife, and Honey teases, Am I In Heaven? vocal teases by Ambrose, and Boogieman Sam quotes. The intro to Gondii contained Shanghai quotes with some lyrics changed to “Bye Bye Chang’e” and the song itself contained Shanghai teases. Magma contained a Rats In The Sky intro. Sea of Trees contained a The Land Before Timeland tease, a You Can Be Your Sillouhette jam, and Daily Blues teases. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases and quote.

Poster by Amy Jean
